message.content:
cs.CV, cs.HC, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.AI

The paper deals with indexing human activities in videos captured from a wearable camera for studies of progression of dementia diseases. This involves analyzing the video data using motion, color, and audio descriptors, and then using a Hidden-Markov Model formulation to classify the test segments. This work involves computer vision, machine learning, and human-computer interaction, which are all relevant to the sub-categories of computer vision (cs.CV), human-computer interaction (cs.HC), multimedia (cs.MM), machine learning (cs.LG), and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Therefore, these are the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper.
